title: Missouri National Recreational River: News
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     News             News         Missouri National Recreational River (MNRR) makes every effort to keep you informed about current news, special events, park programs and ongoing projects. News releases for MNRR will be posted and archived in this area of the website, so check back often to keep current about the happenings at the park. Current Information To find out the latest conditions in the park click on these links:  Current River Conditions Daily River Gauge Readings Weather  Park Newsletter The newest edition of "Currents" the official MNRR Park Newsletter is here:  "Currents" - Summer/Fall 2014 Vol 3 Number 5 Mobile Ranger Station: Summer Programs, Mulberry Bend Overlook Trail, Property Management Plan, Day In the Life Of Bio Tech "Currents" - Summer/Fall 2013 Vol 2 Number 4 Mobile Ranger Station, Bow Creek Recreation Area Restoration, Mulberry Bend: Introduction to the Property, Teacher Ranger Teachers, River Cleanups  "Currents" - Winter/Spring 2013 Vol 2 Number 3 MNRR's 39-Mile District, Salt Cedar, River Steward Recognition, Place Names of the MNRR,Mobile Ranger Station, Upcoming Special Events  "Currents" - Summer/Fall 2012 Vol 2 Number 2 Why MNRR IS A National Park, Turtles of the MNRR, River Steward Restoration, What's New In Interpretation & Education, MNRR Water Trail Paddle Events, 2012 Stakeholder Boat Tours,  Older issues of the newsletter are available by clicking on this link. Social Networking Media To stay connected and learn what is happening at Missouri National Recreational River through our social media sites click on this link to visit our Social Networking page.
